get.summary: Lists all global course design templates
get.description: Lists all global course design templates. Only api callers that have full access can call this method.

get.summary: Get Organization Unit with External Id

parameters.description: The external id of the organization unit

get.description: Returns a list of Global User Groups. Global User Groups are set up for the realm, and will generate groups that can be used on the client level.

get.summary: List of all users in group.
get.description: Returns a list of all members in User Groups that are based on the Global Group with this groupid.

The orgunits endpoint returns information about the available organization units (orgunits).
The response includes the display name, internal and external id and client number.

Returns information about the specified organization unit.
The response includes the display name, internal and external id and client number.
Returns the available projects for the organization unit

delete.description: Deletes the project. The project can only be deleted if the project do not contain any participants.

get.description: Returns project information

patch.description: Updates information about a project. Values are only updated if the fields are specified in the input

get.description: Returns project participants

post.description: Add a user to the project. Participant information is created for the user. In the body object, only one of either email or userid must be specified. The participant needs to be activated before it the user can access it.

delete.description:
Deletes a participant. The user itself will still remain but any state related to the project will be deleted. 
It might not be possible due to constraints from the products in the project to delete the participant. However
this can only be determined at the time of the delete. If a delete fails the participant will have their inError
flag set.

post.description: Activates a participant so that it can be used

Returns a single sign on link for the participant. The link is only usable once and should be used directly. The link expires after a few minutes.

This operation requires the *login link* permission.

get.description: Returns the project team members. A team member is a ....
Returns a list of User Groups for the org unit.
Returns single User Group.

get.summary: List of all users in group.
get.description: Returns a list of all members in User Groups that are based on the Global Group with this groupid.

post.description: Adds a user to user group.

delete.description: Removes a user from a user group.

parameters.name: uuid
parameters.description: UUID of user to remove from group.

get.description: Lists all users. Only api callers that have full access can call this method.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of users to return

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The offset to start listing users from

post.description: Adds a user. No two users can have the same email address. Email is saved WITH case but compared regardless of case. Email can be changed for a user assuming it doesn't cause a conflict.

get.description: Returns information about a user

patch.description: Updates a user. All values that have a key defined in the input will be set. So if a value should not be updated omit it totally from the input, otherwise it will be unset.

get.description:
Returns a thumbnail picture of the user. This can either be a selected picture or an auto generated image. This method doesn't require a full sign in. The api key is sufficient.
The image is square and is likely, but not necessary, to be in 128x128 PNG format. However the format will always be either PNG, JPEG or GIF.

get.summary: Returns information about the projects the user is a participant in.
get.description: Returns information about the projects the user is a participant in. Only the projects that the current token have access to will be listed.
